0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Cataract surgery; Adjunct: a sufficient amount of sodium hyaluronate is slowly and carefully introduced (using a cannula or needle) into the anterior chamber; injection can be performed either before or after delivery of the lens
  • Corneal transplant; Adjunct: the anterior chamber is filled with hyaluronate sodium after removal of the corneal button; the donor graft can then be placed on top of the bed of hyaluronate sodium and sutured in place; additional hyaluronate sodium may be injected to replace what is lost as a result of surgical manipulation
  • Filtering operation on eye; Adjunct: following performance of the trabeculectomy, inject slowly and carefully through a corneal paracentesis to reconstitute the anterior chamber; further injection of Healon(R) can be continued to allow it to extrude into the subconjunctival filtration site through and around the sutured outer scleral flap
  • Insertion of intraocular lens; Adjunct: a sufficient amount of sodium hyaluronate is slowly and carefully introduced (using a cannula or needle) into the anterior chamber; injection can be performed either before or after delivery of the lens
  • Operative procedure on anterior chamber of eye; Adjunct: a sufficient amount of sodium hyaluronate is slowly and carefully introduced (using a cannula or needle) into the anterior chamber; injection can be performed either before or after delivery of the lens
  • Osteoarthritis of knee: Euflexxa(R), inject 20 mg per 2 mL (contents of prefilled syringe) INTRA-ARTICULARLY into the knee at weekly intervals for 3 weeks
  • Osteoarthritis of knee: Gel-One(R), inject 30 mg per 3 mL (contents of prefilled syringe) INTRA-ARTICULARLY into the knee
  • Osteoarthritis of knee: Hyalgan(R), inject 20 mg per 2 mL (contents of prefilled syringe) INTRA-ARTICULARLY into the knee once weekly for a total of 5 injections
  • Osteoarthritis of knee: Supartz(R), inject 25 mg per 2.5 mL (contents of prefilled syringe) INTRA-ARTICULARLY into the knee once weekly for a total of 5 injections
  • Osteoarthritis of knee: Synvisc(R), inject 16 mg per 2 mL (contents of prefilled syringe) INTRA-ARTICULARLY into the knee once weekly for a total of 3 injections
  • Retinal detachment repair; Adjunct: sodium hyaluronate is slowly introduced into the vitreous cavity; by directing the injection, sodium hyaluronate can be used to separate membranes (eg, epiretinal membranes) away from the retina for safe excision and release of traction
  • Subacromial impingement, Syndrome of the shoulder: 20 mg INJECTION into subacromial space once weekly for 3 weeks was used in a clinical trial (n=80)
  • Wound: Clean and disinfect wound/ulcer prior to treatment, then apply a thin layer to affected area(s) 2 or 3 times per day; cover area with a sterile gauze pad and, if needed, with an elastic or compressive bandage

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• safety and effectiveness of intraocular injection in children have not been established
  • safety and efficacy of intra-articular injection in pediatric patients have not been established, including patients younger than 21 years

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Cataract surgery; Adjunct
  • Corneal transplant; Adjunct
  • Filtering operation on eye; Adjunct
  • Insertion of intraocular lens; Adjunct
  • Operative procedure on anterior chamber of eye; Adjunct
  • Osteoarthritis of knee
  • Retinal detachment repair; Adjunct
  • Wound
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
  • Arthropathy - Disorder of shoulder
  • Intravitreal tamponade
  • Keratoconjunctivitis sicca
  • Subacromial impingement, Syndrome of the shoulder

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• hypersensitivity to hyaluronate preparations (Hyalgan(R), Hylira(R), Provisc(R))
  • knee joint infections or skin disease at injection site, active (Hyalgan(R))

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• allergic and anaphylactic reactions have been reported (Hyalgan(R))
  • allergic reactions may occur due to potential for minute amounts of protein in the preparation (Provisc(R))
  • allergy to avian or avian-derived products, including eggs, feathers, or poultry; use caution (Hyalgan(R))
  • aphakic diabetic patients undergoing posterior segment procedures; avoid using large amounts of sodium hyaluronate (Healon(R))
  • concomitant use of disinfectants containing quarternary ammonium salts should be avoided (hyaluronic acid can precipitate in their presence) (Hyalgan(R)))
  • elevated intraocular pressure, postoperative, has been reported; avoid overfilling anterior or posterior segment of eye and insure complete removal of hyaluronate sodium from eye after procedure (Healon(R), Healon5(R), HealonGV(R), Provisc(R), Shellgel(R))
  • elevated intraocular pressure, preoperative, may exacerbate condition postoperatively (Healon5(R), HealonGV(R))
  • glaucoma, preexisting, or compromised outflow; postoperative intraocular pressure may be elevated (Healon(R), Healon5(R), Healon GV(R), Shellgel(R))
  • increased inflammation in the injected knee, transient, has been reported in some patients with inflammatory arthritis (ie, rheumatoid or gouty arthritis) (Hyalgan(R))

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Musculoskeletal:Injection site pain (23%)
Serious
  • Musculoskeletal:Pseudogout, Septic arthritis
  • Ophthalmic:Raised intraocular pressure, Postoperative, likely if hyaluronate not removed as completely as possible after surgery
  • Other:Inflammatory disorder, Postoperative, including iritis, hypopyon, endophthalmitis (rare)

2.title: Class
2.mono:
• Cartilaginous Defect Repair Agent
  • Dermatological Agent
  • Keratolytic
  • Ophthalmologic Agent
  • Protectant, Dermatological
  • Surgical Aid, Ocular
  • Wound Care Agent

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Sodium hyaluronate forms a viscoelastic solution in water that assists in absorbing mechanical stress and provides a protective buffer for tissues and acts as a protective transport vehicle.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    vial/syringe is intended for single use; use immediately after opening and discard unused contents
  • Intra-articular
    • do not prepare skin with quaternary ammonium salt disinfectant; may cause precipitation of product
    • injection of subQ lidocaine or similar local anesthetic prior to injection of product may be performed
    • remove joint effusion prior to injection; use separate syringes for removing fluid and for injection, but use the same needle
    • recommended needle size for prefilled syringe: Euflexxa, 17- to 21-mm gauge; Gel-One(R), 18- to 20-gauge, Hyalgan(R), 20-gauge; Supartz(R), 22- to 23-gauge; Synvisc(R), 18- to 22-gauge
    • vials/syringes are for single-use only; use immediately after opening container
    • use separate vial/syringe for treatment of bilateral knee
  • Ophthalmic
    • (ProVisc(R) prefilled syringe) use syringe assembly for injection only; use for aspiration is not advised
    • (ProVisc(R) prefilled syringe) do not attach delivery system to instruments other than the one provided
    • allow solution to come to room temperature (approximately 20 to 40 minutes) prior to use
    • irrigation/aspiration should be used to create a fluid-filled space above the lens before initiating phacoemulsification (Healon5(R))
    • use solution only if clear; if cloudiness or precipitation is observed, remove cloudy or precipitated material by irrigation and/or aspiration
    • avoid reuse of cannulas; if necessary, rinse cannula thoroughly with sterile distilled water
    • express small amount from syringe prior to use and examine for particulate matter, specifically rubber particles
    • avoid trapping air bubbles behind sodium hyaluronate (Healon(R))
    • at the close of surgery, completely remove sodium hyaluronate from anterior chamber by irrigation or aspiration; do not overfill the anterior chamber

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• ophthalmic surgical aid (ocular injection): reduced trauma to corneal endothelium and surrounding tissue
  • osteoarthritis of the knee (intra-articular): improved range of motion, decreased early morning stiffness and painful/swollen joint(s)
  • (ocular injection): intraocular pressure; during anterior segment ophthalmic procedures

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
• Amvisc
    Intraocular Solution: 12 MG/ML
  • Amvisc Plus
    Intraocular Solution: 16 MG/ML
  • Bionect
    • Topical Cream: 0.2 %
    • Topical Gel/Jelly: 0.2 %
  • Euflexxa
    Injection Solution: 10 MG/ML
  • Gel-One
    Injection Gel/Jelly: 30 MG/3 ML
  • Hyalgan
    Injection Solution: 10 MG/ML
  • HyGel
    Topical Gel/Jelly: 0.2 %
  • Hylira
    • Topical Gel/Jelly: 0.2 %
    • Topical Lotion: 0.1 %
  • Provisc
    Intraocular Solution: 10 MG/ML
  • Supartz
    Injection Solution: 10 MG/ML

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Advise patients receiving the intra-articular formulation, to avoid stressful, prolonged, or weight-bearing activities on the affected joint for at least 48 h after injection.
  • Patients receiving the intra-articular formulation should report signs/symptoms of infection at injection site.
